name: Bryan Wilks

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: No! I'm not talking to you anymore! You're a jerk and I hate you!

topics.topic_text: Actually, I give up. I can't find anywhere that will take you in.
topics.response_text: Oh, okay. I understand. Thanks for trying though.

topics.topic_text: I found a place with lots of kids your age. I'll tell you how to get there.
topics.response_text: Well, it would have been nicer to live with Vera, but this will probably be pretty fun too!

topics.topic_text: Sure did. It's a beautiful place called Paradise Falls. Here, put this on.
topics.response_text: W-what is this weird thing?

topics.topic_text: It's a Paradise Welcome Necklace. It'll help you find your way, you lucky devil!
topics.response_text: I can't believe everything you've done for me. Most people would have kept on walking when I ran up to them screaming like I did.

topics.topic_text: Something to remember me by. It'll lead you home.
topics.response_text: I can't believe everything you've done for me. Most people would have kept on walking when I ran up to them screaming like I did.

topics.topic_text: It's a slave collar, I sold your dumb ass for caps.
topics.response_text: You son-of-a-bitch!!!!

topics.topic_text: I sure did, Bryan. Vera said she'd take you in!
topics.response_text: You really found her!? Oh, thank you so much!

topics.topic_text: Let me ask you something else.
topics.response_text: All right. What is it?

topics.topic_text: Those what? What's the matter?
topics.response_text: Those... THINGS. They keep coming. They scare me! Make it stop!

topics.topic_text: Calm down, kid.
topics.response_text: No... those things will get me! I can't. Gotta' keep going!

topics.topic_text: What the heck is your problem?
topics.response_text: Those things... they're gonna' get me too! Can't stop now!

topics.topic_text: Hey, hey. Calm down. It's going to be okay. I promise.
topics.response_text: You won't leave me like all the other grown-ups? You... you can help me?

topics.topic_text: Hey, kid. It's okay. I'm a big, tough guy. I can take care of you!
topics.response_text: You look stronger than all the other grown-ups. Can you... can you protect me?

topics.topic_text: Look, kid. There's no such thing as monsters.
topics.response_text: R... really? No monsters?

topics.topic_text: Unless you tell me what the problem is I can't help you.
topics.response_text: THOSE things! It's all their fault! They did this to us!

topics.topic_text: Okay kid. I'm going to say it once. Stop your whining!
topics.response_text: No! You don't care! The grown-ups never cared! Now they're all dead! Well, fine! You'll just die too!

topics.topic_text: Is that a warning, or a threat?
topics.response_text: See! I knew it! You don't care! No one ever cares!

topics.topic_text: All right, I'm sorry. Calm down and tell me what's going on.
topics.response_text: Please don't get mad at me... I'm scared. I don't know what to do.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to help, but I need to know more first.
topics.response_text: Those... big things. They're all over Grayditch and they killed everyone!

topics.topic_text: Sorry, kid. Help costs caps, and you look pretty broke to me.
topics.response_text: You grown-ups are all the same! All you care about is your stuff!

topics.topic_text: I don't know... you look like a tasty snack for a monster.
topics.response_text: Why are you so mean!? All you care about is yourself! Well, fine!

topics.topic_text: Don't be like that. I'm sorry for being mean.
topics.response_text: Okay, I forgive you.

topics.topic_text: Okay, okay. I'm sorry.
topics.response_text: No! They always just say sorry, but then it turns out to be a bunch of lies.

topics.topic_text: What's it going to take for you to forgive me?
topics.response_text: When I was bad, my pappa made me apologize three times. Then he decided if I was really or sorry or not.

topics.topic_text: Forget it, I don't care. I'm out of here.
topics.response_text: Fine. Hmph.

topics.topic_text: I'm sorry! There, that's three.
topics.response_text: Good. You did it. Now I'll talk to you.

topics.topic_text: Okay. "I'm sorry three times!" Ha! That's exactly what you said to say!
topics.response_text: Oh man! You got me!

topics.topic_text: Bryan, I'm sorry, but your father is dead.
topics.response_text: Yeah... I snuck back home a little while ago and found him laying there.

topics.topic_text: Your father's dead.
topics.response_text: Yeah... I snuck back home a little while ago and found him laying there.

topics.topic_text: Sorry, kid. Your old man is ant food.
topics.response_text: Well you don't have to be such a meanie about it.

topics.topic_text: Fine, I'll take care of everything.
topics.response_text: You gotta stop it so this can't happen to anyone else's family ever again!

topics.topic_text: I'll stop whatever started this, I promise you.
topics.response_text: You gotta stop it so this can't happen to anyone else's family ever again!

topics.topic_text: My part in this is all done. Sorry, kid.
topics.response_text: Please don't go! Please!

topics.topic_text: People die all the time out here. Get used to it.
topics.response_text: Why does everyone who comes through here have to be so mean!?

topics.topic_text: Why don't you just forget about it and clear on out of here?
topics.response_text: Look, my dad used to always say "You can do whatever you want in life but the family comes first."

topics.topic_text: If you're talking about the Fire Ants, I'm already working on it.
topics.response_text: You-you are?! I can't believe it!

topics.topic_text: Sorry, kid. Help costs caps, and you look pretty broke to me.
topics.response_text: Look, I know if you find my pappa he's gotta have some caps with him. He'd pay you! Please, mister!

topics.topic_text: I got my own problems right now, kid.
topics.response_text: Why are you so mean!?

topics.topic_text: Hey, are you okay? You shouldn't be alone in a place like this.
topics.response_text: My name's Bryan Wilks. I live in Grayditch. Well, that is, I did until those Fire Ants turned this place into a cemetery.

topics.topic_text: Calm down, calm down. Just who the heck are you?
topics.response_text: My name's Bryan Wilks. I live in Grayditch. Well, that is, I did until those Fire Ants turned this place into a cemetery.

topics.topic_text: That's wonderful, kid. Now scram.
topics.response_text: Awww, come on. You're pretty tough taking out all those ants by yourself!

topics.topic_text: I'm just glad you're safe.
topics.response_text: I wish I had something to give you for all the work you did, but I never really had much to start with.

topics.topic_text: Yep, it was all me.
topics.response_text: I wish I had something to give you for all the work you did, but I never really had much to start with.

topics.topic_text: All the ants are dead so I'm done here. Go home.
topics.response_text: I wish I had something to give you for all the work you did, but I never really had much to start with.

topics.topic_text: Don't worry, Bryan... I think I know how to take care of these ants.
topics.response_text: Just be careful, mister... I don't wanna lose you too.

topics.topic_text: I know where the Ant Queen lives.
topics.response_text: You do?!

topics.topic_text: Haven't found a thing. (Lie)
topics.response_text: Awww shucks. Well, keep trying, mister. I promise I'll be good and stay right here for you.

topics.topic_text: So, how are you getting along now that you've left Grayditch behind?
topics.response_text: Oh, Vera is the nicest lady ever! It's so cool that you brought me here!

topics.topic_text: I can't leave you here alone. Let me find you a place to live.
topics.response_text: Really? You mean it!?

topics.topic_text: Yeah, you'll be better off staying at home.
topics.response_text: I dunno... I kinda' don't like it in here. Gonna be really lonely.

topics.topic_text: Let me think about it.
topics.response_text: Well, okay. Just don't forget about me.

topics.topic_text: Mind if I ask you some important stuff about Doctor Lesko?
topics.response_text: Naw, go ahead. I like talking to you.

topics.topic_text: Did your pappa ever tell you what he thought of Lesko?
topics.response_text: Well, I remember once they were all yelling at each other and stuff. Kinda weird cause Doc Lesko is so nice and all.

topics.topic_text: Before Lesko showed up, were there ever ants in Grayditch?
topics.response_text: Well, there used to be like big regular ants once in a while... but pappa could usually hunt 'em down with Mr. Brandice across the street.

topics.topic_text: Do you trust Lesko?
topics.response_text: I dunno. I mean, he always talked real funny and didn't let me touch anything in his house.

topics.topic_text: I found him, actually... inside Marigold Metro.
topics.response_text: Really?! Oh my gosh!

topics.topic_text: Any idea where I can look for someone to take care of you?
topics.response_text: Well, pappa always told me about my cousin Vera. She lives on some big, giant ship somewhere or something.

topics.topic_text: I think I have some bad news for you.
topics.response_text: Oh no! What happened?

topics.topic_text: What happened here?
topics.response_text: It used to be kinda' nice. No one bothered us there, I guess because we were so close to D.C.

topics.topic_text: Did you know the others in town very well?
topics.response_text: Naw. People don't like to stay long in Grayditch. The D.C. Ruins aren't a great place to make a home, you know?

topics.topic_text: Who else lived in Grayditch?
topics.response_text: Ummm, besides me and my pappa, there was Doc Lesko who stayed with us and Will Brandice and his momma and pappa too.

topics.topic_text: Mind if I ask about some of the people who lived here?
topics.response_text: Naw, go ahead. It's just nice to talk to anyone about stuff at all.

topics.topic_text: About the other people from Grayditch...
topics.response_text: Yeah?

topics.topic_text: Tell me about this "Doc Lesko."
topics.response_text: He was a strange man. He paid pappa some caps to help him build a shack and carry a bunch of junk into it.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the Brandice Family.
topics.response_text: Well, there was Will... he was sorta my friend. And then there was his dad and his mom.

topics.topic_text: Where did the Brandices live?
topics.response_text: Right across the street actually. It was pretty swell having someone to hang out with so close by.

topics.topic_text: So, you and Will were good friends?
topics.response_text: Yeah, Will was super nice to me. He was like a year older than me I think. He even shared his comic books with me.

topics.topic_text: How about Will's parents?
topics.response_text: Well, his mom was nice too. She was kind of quiet, but she always took care of me and my pappa when we came over.

topics.topic_text: Will's dad was scary? How so?
topics.response_text: He was like always watching me and my dad real careful, like he didn't trust us or something.

topics.topic_text: Where did Doctor Lesko stay?
topics.response_text: He spent all of his of time in that shack next door to my house.

topics.topic_text: Do you have any idea what Doctor Lesko was doing in Grayditch?
topics.response_text: Naw. He was a nice man, but he never wanted to play with me very much and we barely talked.

topics.topic_text: Did Doctor Lesko have any weird stuff in his place?
topics.response_text: I dunno, all kinds of doohickeys. Boxes with lots of lights, some funny glass bottles....

topics.topic_text: Okay. I'll go look for your father.
topics.response_text: You will? Really? Thanks a whole lot!

topics.topic_text: Is there anywhere you can hide while I search?
topics.response_text: Well, there is the personal shelter next to the old diner.

topics.topic_text: This probably isn't the best place for you to stand...
topics.response_text: You think I didn't know that? I been hiding in this place for days!

topics.topic_text: Okay kid, I said I'd do it. Now scram!
topics.response_text: Humph... you don't gotta be such a jerk about it.

topics.topic_text: Hey, I know it's scary to be alone. Just hang in there!
topics.response_text: Wow, you sound as nice as my pappa.

topics.topic_text: Look, anything else you can do to help might save lives.
topics.response_text: You know, maybe this will help and maybe it won't, but pappa hid a bunch of stuff behind the old diner in a dumpster.

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about Marigold Station?
topics.response_text: Whoa! That's a bad place. My dad said to never, ever go down there.

topics.topic_text: Can you tell me more about the things attacking Grayditch?
topics.response_text: Well, they're big ugly things that crawl around on six legs. They got huge teeth and skitter around grabbing everything in their path.

topics.topic_text: Have they always been around?
topics.response_text: Naw. Those things started coming around only in the last few months.

topics.topic_text: Is there any special way to hurt them?
topics.response_text: My pappa had a gun, and he said it hurt those things, but he said they were the dumbest Fuckin' Ants he ever saw.

topics.topic_text: Did you hear anyone mention anything about an Ant Queen?
topics.response_text: Well... yeah. I think I heard Doc Lesko mention something like a queen or something.

topics.topic_text: Where's your house?
topics.response_text: Look for the house nearest to the billboard that's sticking out of the ground. It's pretty close to the diner, you can't miss it.

topics.topic_text: SpeechChallengeFailure
topics.response_text: No! Those things! They're right behind me! Leave me alone!

conversation.response_text: {Shooting Noise}I wish I was tough like you!{Make a gun shooting noise like a kid would.}
Holy moley! You actually came back like you said you would! Did you find me a home?
Wow, sure is hot in here.

description:
Bryan Wilks is a 11 year-old Caucasian Male.

A young boy living in Grayditch with his father, Fred Wilks. The Wilks family arrived in Grayditch in 2276, intending to use the small settlement as a temporary stopover during their travels. Despite his youth, Bryan has been taught survival skills in the harsh wasteland environment, and his father trusts him enough to give him a supply key for emergencies. Bryan has formed a friendship with Will Brandice, the only other child in the settlement, as their fathers work together to supply the town and hunt giant ants that threaten the community.

Bryan Wilks's Personality: Naive and innocent yet resilient, Bryan has a straightforward way of viewing the world that sometimes misses subtleties or metaphors. He's resourceful enough to survive in the wasteland but still possesses the simple perspective of a child. He's friendly and trusting, as evidenced by his positive view of the socially awkward Doctor Lesko.

Bryan Wilks's Backstory: Born to Fred Wilks in the post-nuclear wasteland, Bryan has spent his childhood learning to survive in the harsh environment. When his father decided to travel to the Capital Wasteland in 2276, they settled temporarily in Grayditch, a small community with bricked houses that offered some respite from their journey. Bryan quickly befriended Will Brandice, the only other boy in the settlement, as their parents worked together to support the town. Bryan's father taught him essential survival skills, including how to identify threats and the importance of community cooperation.
